body.p: offers an add-on that contributes actions into the following submenus:

ul.li: Batch Converter submenu located in the Tools menu and the contextual menu of resources in the Project view.
Additional conversions submenu located in the File Import submenu.
Import submenu located in the Append child, Insert Before and Insert After submenus from the contextual menu in the DITA Maps Manager view.

body.p:
Once the add-on is installed, the actions found in the submenu allow for batch conversions between the following formats:
HTML to XHTML
HTML to DITA
Markdown to XHTML
Markdown to DITA
XML to JSON
JSON to XML
HTML to DocBook4
HTML to DocBook5
Markdown to DocBook4
Markdown to DocBook5
Excel to DITA
Word (.doc or .docx) to XHTML
Word (.doc or .docx) to DITA
Word (.doc or .docx) to DocBook4
Word (.doc or .docx) to DocBook5
When actions are invoked from the contextual menu of the DITA Maps Manager view, the documents resulted from the conversion are automatically inserted in the map as follow:

ul.li: Actions from Append child insert map nodes as children of the currently selected node
Actions from Insert Before insert map nodes as siblings of the currently selected node, above the current node in the map.
Actions from Insert After insert map nodes as siblings of the currently selected node, below the current node in the map.

body.p: The easiest way to install the add-on is to select one of the following actions

ul.li: Batch Converter from the Tools menu.
Additional conversions from the File Import submenu.
Import from the Append child, Insert Before and Insert After submenus located in the contextual menu of the DITA Maps Manager view.

body.p: A message prompt will ask if you want to install it. Simply click Install, follow the on-screen instructions, and restart . The submenus contributed by add-on will now be available and will contain the list of available conversions. Selecting an action from the submenu will open a dialog box where you can configure the options for the corresponding conversion.
For more information, see the details for this Batch Converter add-on in GitHub.
